sense.name: yield, create, make
sense.examples: This tree has stopped producing oranges. We produced more cars last year than we sold. The physicists succeeded in producing a chain reaction. The body produces extra white cells in response to infection. It requires a lot of skill to produce a great wine.

sense.name: exhibit, release
sense.examples: She suddenly produced the report we had been looking for. They want to produce a film based on his book.

sense.name: develop, acquire
sense.examples: Using that lotion produced funny spots on my hands. Constant scratching produced hot spots on the dog's legs.
